title: Persepolis
summary: The ceremonial capital of the Achaemenid Empire, known for its monumental staircases and bas-reliefs.
facts: Founded by Darius I around 518 BCE.

title: Pasargadae
summary: The first dynastic capital of the Achaemenid Empire built by Cyrus the Great.
facts: Home to the Tomb of Cyrus the Great.

title: Sheikh Lotfollah Mosque
summary: A masterpiece of Safavid art noted for its turquoise dome and intricate tilework.
facts: Color of dome changes with daylight.

title: Goharshad Mosque
summary: Commissioned by Queen Goharshad, known for its high iwan and turquoise decorations.
facts: Part of the Imam Reza Shrine complex.

title: Golestan Palace
summary: The royal Qajar complex blending Persian and European aesthetics.

title: Azadi Tower
summary: Modern landmark combining Achaemenid and Islamic geometry.

title: Windcatchers of Yazd
summary: Traditional Iranian air-conditioning towers harnessing desert winds.
facts: Historic City of Yazd is UNESCO-listed.

title: Karim Khan Citadel
summary: A hybrid of palace and fortress built by Karim Khan Zand.
facts: Served as royal residence and later as a prison.
